titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: The Education Society of the Presbyterian Church in the United States was formed in the autumn of 1818. In 1820 the name was changed to Presbyterian Education Society. For a number of years it continued its operations as an independent Society, and had under its care about one hundred young men. In 1827, it became connected with the American Education Society, and was known as the Presbyterian Branch. In this capacity, the field of its operations was limited to the states of New York, New Jersey, and Pennsylvania. In 1831, the operations of the Presbyterian Branch were folded into the American Education Society.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of the Presbyterian Education Society. Materials include: copies of printed addresses by the Board of Directors of the Presbyterian Education Society, 1820-1831; an address given by Edward D. Griffin to the Society, 1824; subscription book listing subscribers and amount paid for annual subscriptions, undated (appears to be for one year); and an invitation to the 1872 annual meeting of the Philadelphia Education Society, signed by the secretary, Charles Brown, addressee unknown.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
